name: Cairo
hint: Egypt's capital, the largest city in Africa, located on the banks of the Nile

name: Lagos
hint: Nigeria's largest city and economic hub, a major port on the Atlantic coast of West Africa

name: Nairobi
hint: Kenya's capital, a major East African hub with a national park within city limits

name: Johannesburg
hint: South Africa's largest city, built on gold mining, the economic powerhouse of southern Africa

name: Casablanca
hint: Morocco's largest city and chief port, located on the Atlantic coast of North Africa

name: Addis Ababa
hint: Ethiopia's capital and the diplomatic capital of Africa, headquarters of the African Union

name: Dar es Salaam
hint: Tanzania's largest city and former capital, a major port on the Indian Ocean

name: Accra
hint: The capital of Ghana, located on the Gulf of Guinea in West Africa

name: Kinshasa
hint: The capital of the Democratic Republic of the Congo, the largest French-speaking city in the world

name: Luanda
hint: The capital of Angola, a major port city on the Atlantic coast of southwestern Africa

name: Algiers
hint: The capital of Algeria, a white-washed city on the Mediterranean coast of North Africa

name: Cape Town
hint: South Africa's legislative capital, located at the foot of Table Mountain near the Cape of Good Hope
